intro: Cacalia clavata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in clusters around the stem, giving it its common name. Cacalia clavata is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
